headline: Mag 7 Earnings Could Spark a Year-End Surge. What the Charts of Meta, Google, Amazon Say.

All components except  Nvidia  are scheduled to report earnings by the end of next week, and those results could set the tone for a year-end rally.  The stock broke out of a bull flag formation to close at a new all-time high.

headline: Apple nears $4T market cap. Is it catching up in the AI race?
summary: Apple (AAPL) closed at a record high on Monday, has reportedly had strong iPhone 17 sales, received multiple upgrades and price target boosts from Wall Street analysts this week, and is on track to hit a $4 trillion market capitalization — replacing Microsoft (MSFT) as the second-most valuable public company in the world. Yahoo Finance Senior Business Reporter Ines Ferré and Sevens Report Research founder Tom Essaye join Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to discuss Apple's comeback in the artificial intelligence (AI) race. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Amazon Cloud Reputation Takes Hit After Outage Lasting 15 Hours
summary: The incident, which some analysts are calling Amazon’s worst outage since 2021, reminded the world of the perils of depending on a handful of cloud companies to deliver crucial computing and internet services.  Outages like Monday’s strike at a core premise of the cloud: that a centralized operation full of sharp engineers will keep servers running better and more efficiently than individual companies’ own staff.

headline: How Apple’s Vietnam Manufacturing Deal With BYD (SEHK:1211) Has Changed Its Investment Story

This collaboration highlights BYD's growing influence as a hardware supplier beyond electric vehicles, even as it manages heightened regulatory and operational challenges at home and abroad. We'll explore how the record vehicle recall and lowered sales outlook may reshape BYD's investment narrative...

headline: Omdia: India Smartphone Market Grew 3% as Brands Gear Up for Festive Season
summary: LONDON, October 21, 2025--India’s smartphone market grew 3% year-on-year (YoY) in Q3 2025, reaching 48.4 million units shipped according to the latest research from Omdia. Vendors filled the channels with new stocks in expectation of a high-demand festive period. The modest growth was driven by a wave of new launches in July and August, retail incentivization and an earlier festive season that pulled forward inventory flows.
